Package SystemController

Provides the high level structures that initialize the game and switch between the Menu state and the GamePlay state of the game.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Game Class in charge of initializing the game and creating the JFrame object where all the elements for both the MenuState and the GamePlayState will be rendered.
GameController GameController manages the single thread of the application, and it trickles user inputs to the corresponding game state the user is in.
GameFileManager Interface in charge of saving and loading gamePlay files from the system.
GameState Interface implemented by the two main Controllers of the game: MenuManager and GamePlayManager.
GameStateManager Controller used to switch between the two states of the application: Menu or GamePlay.
SoundController Class used to store the sound used throughout the game.
 

Enum Summary
TopLevelState Constants used to represent the two fundamental states of the application: MenuState and GamePlayState.
 

Package SystemController Description

Provides the high level structures that initialize the game and switch between the Menu state and the GamePlay state of the game.
